column2: When all were done, the major-domo of the Prince of Helium recalled to the block such as had favourably impressed him.
column3: When all were done, the major domo of the Prince of Helium recalled to the block such as had favourably impressed him.

column2: For such he had made a fair offer.
column3: For such he had made a fair offer.

column2: There was little haggling as to price, and none at all when Vas Kor was placed upon the block.
column3: There was little haggling as to price, and none at all when Vas Kor was placed upon the block.

column2: His merchant-master accepted the first offer that was made for him, and thus a Dusarian noble entered the household of Carthoris.
column3: His merchant master accepted the first offer that was made for him, and thus a Dusarian noble entered the household of Carthoris.

column2: CHAPTER III
column3: CHAPTER three

column2: TREACHERY
column3: TREACHERY

column2: The day following the coming of Vas Kor to the palace of the Prince of Helium great excitement reigned throughout the twin cities, reaching its climax in the palace of Carthoris.
column3: The day following the coming of Vas Kor to the palace of the Prince of Helium great excitement reigned throughout the twin cities, reaching its climax in the palace of Carthoris.

column2: Word had come of the abduction of Thuvia of Ptarth from her father's court, and with it the veiled hint that the Prince of Helium might be suspected of considerable knowledge of the act and the whereabouts of the princess.
column3: Word had come of the abduction of Thuvia of Ptarth from her father's court, and with it the veiled hint that the Prince of Helium might be suspected of considerable knowledge of the act and the whereabouts of the princess.

column2: In the council chamber of John Carter, Warlord of Mars, was Tardos Mors, Jeddak of Helium; Mors Kajak, his son, Jed of Lesser Helium; Carthoris, and a score of the great nobles of the empire.
column3: In the council chamber of john Carter, Warlord of Mars, was Tardos Mors, Jeddak of Helium; Mors Kajak, his son, Jed of Lesser Helium; Carthoris, and a score of the great nobles of the empire.

column2: There must be no war between Ptarth and Helium, my son, said John Carter.
column3: There must be no war between Ptarth and Helium, my son, said john Carter.

column2: That you are innocent of the charge that has been placed against you by insinuation, we well know; but Thuvan Dihn must know it well, too.	That you are innocent of the charge that has been placed against you by insinuation, we well know; but Thuvan Dihn must know it well, too.
column3: true

column2: There is but one who may convince him, and that one be you.	There is but one who may convince him, and that one be you.
column3: true

column2: You must hasten at once to the court of Ptarth, and by your presence there as well as by your words assure him that his suspicions are groundless.
column3: You must hasten at once to the court of Ptarth, and by your presence there as well as by your words assure him that his suspicions are groundless.

column2: Bear with you the authority of the Warlord of Barsoom, and of the Jeddak of Helium to offer every resource of the allied powers to assist Thuvan Dihn to recover his daughter and punish her abductors, whomsoever they may be.
column3: Bear with you the authority of the Warlord of Barsoom, and of the Jeddak of Helium to offer every resource of the allied powers to assist Thuvan Dihn to recover his daughter and punish her abductors, whomsoever they may be.

column2: Go!	Go!
column3: true

column2: I know that I do not need to urge upon you the necessity for haste."
column3: I know that I do not need to urge upon you the necessity for haste."

column2: Carthoris left the council chamber, and hastened to his palace.
column3: Carthoris left the council chamber, and hastened to his palace.

column2: Here slaves were busy in a moment setting things to rights for the departure of their master.
column3: Here slaves were busy in a moment setting things to rights for the departure of their master.

column2: Several worked about the swift flier that would bear the Prince of Helium rapidly toward Ptarth.
column3: Several worked about the swift flier that would bear the Prince of Helium rapidly toward Ptarth.

column2: At last all was done.
column3: At last all was done.

column2: But two armed slaves remained on guard. The setting sun hung low above the horizon.
column3: But two armed slaves remained on guard. The setting sun hung low above the horizon.

column2: In a moment darkness would envelop all.
column3: In a moment darkness would envelop all.

column2: One of the guardsmen, a giant of a fellow across whose right cheek there ran a thin scar from temple to mouth, approached his companion. His gaze was directed beyond and above his comrade.
column3: One of the guardsmen, a giant of a fellow across whose right cheek there ran a thin scar from temple to mouth, approached his companion. His gaze was directed beyond and above his comrade.

column2: When he had come quite close he spoke.
column3: When he had come quite close he spoke.

column2: What strange craft is that? he asked.
column3: What strange craft is that? he asked.

column2: The other turned about quickly to gaze heavenward.
column3: The other turned about quickly to gaze heavenward.

column2: Scarce was his back turned toward the giant than the short-sword of the latter was plunged beneath his left shoulder blade, straight through his heart.
column3: Scarce was his back turned toward the giant than the short sword of the latter was plunged beneath his left shoulder blade, straight through his heart.

column2: Voiceless, the soldier sank in his tracks--stone dead.
column3: Voiceless, the soldier sank in his tracks-stone dead.

column2: Quickly the murderer dragged the corpse into the black shadows within the hangar.
column3: Quickly the murderer dragged the corpse into the black shadows within the hangar.

column2: Then he returned to the flier.
column3: Then he returned to the flier.

column2: Drawing a cunningly wrought key from his pocket-pouch, he removed the cover of the right-hand dial of the controlling destination compass.
column3: Drawing a cunningly wrought key from his pocket pouch, he removed the cover of the right-hand dial of the controlling destination compass.

column2: For a moment he studied the construction of the mechanism beneath.
column3: For a moment he studied the construction of the mechanism beneath.

column2: Then he returned the dial to its place, set the pointer, and removed it again to note the resultant change in the position of the parts affected by the act.
column3: Then he returned the dial to its place, set the pointer, and removed it again to note the resultant change in the position of the parts affected by the act.

column2: A smile crossed his lips.
column3: A smile crossed his lips.

column2: With a pair of cutters he snipped off the projection which extended through the dial from the external pointer--now the latter might be moved to any point upon the dial without affecting the mechanism below.
column3: With a pair of cutters he snipped off the projection which extended through the dial from the external pointer-now the latter might be moved to any point upon the dial without affecting the mechanism below.

column2: In other words, the eastern hemisphere dial was useless.
column3: In other words, the eastern hemisphere dial was useless.

column2: Now he turned his attention to the western dial.
column3: Now he turned his attention to the western dial.

column2: This he set upon a certain point.
column3: This he set upon a certain point.

column2: Afterward he removed the cover of this dial also, and with keen tool cut the steel finger from the under side of the pointer.
column3: Afterward he removed the cover of this dial also, and with keen tool cut the steel finger from the under side of the pointer.

column2: As quickly as possible he replaced the second dial cover, and resumed his place on guard.
column3: As quickly as possible he replaced the second dial cover, and resumed his place on guard.

column2: To all intents and purposes the compass was as efficient as before; but, as a matter of fact, the moving of the pointers upon the dials resulted now in no corresponding shift of the mechanism beneath--and the device was set, immovably, upon a destination of the slave's own choosing.
column3: To all intents and purposes the compass was as efficient as before; but, as a matter of fact, the moving of the pointers upon the dials resulted now in no corresponding shift of the mechanism beneath-and the device was set, immovably, upon a destination of the slave's own choosing.

column2: Presently came Carthoris, accompanied by but a handful of his gentlemen.
column3: Presently came Carthoris, accompanied by but a handful of his gentlemen.

column2: He cast but a casual glance upon the single slave who stood guard.
column3: He cast but a casual glance upon the single slave who stood guard.

column2: The fellow's thin, cruel lips, and the sword-cut that ran from temple to mouth aroused the suggestion of an unpleasant memory within him.
column3: The fellow's thin, cruel lips, and the sword cut that ran from temple to mouth aroused the suggestion of an unpleasant memory within him.

column2: He wondered where Saran Tal had found the man-- then the matter faded from his thoughts, and in another moment the Prince of Helium was laughing and chatting with his companions, though below the surface his heart was cold with dread, for what contingencies confronted Thuvia of Ptarth he could not even guess.
column3: He wondered where Saran Tal had found the man- then the matter faded from his thoughts, and in another moment the Prince of Helium was laughing and chatting with his companions, though below the surface his heart was cold with dread, for what contingencies confronted Thuvia of Ptarth he could not even guess.

column2: First to his mind, naturally, had sprung the thought that Astok of Dusar had stolen the fair Ptarthian; but almost simultaneously with the report of the abduction had come news of the great fetes at Dusar in honour of the return of the jeddak's son to the court of his father.
column3: First to his mind, naturally, had sprung the thought that Astok of Dusar had stolen the fair Ptarthian; but almost simultaneously with the report of the abduction had come news of the great fetes at Dusar in honour of the return of the jeddak's son to the court of his father.

column2: It could not have been he, thought Carthoris, for on the very night that Thuvia was taken Astok had been in Dusar, and yet--
column3: It could not have been he, thought Carthoris, for on the very night that Thuvia was taken Astok had been in Dusar, and yet-

column2: He entered the flier, exchanging casual remarks with his companions as he unlocked the mechanism of the compass and set the pointer upon the capital city of Ptarth.
column3: He entered the flier, exchanging casual remarks with his companions as he unlocked the mechanism of the compass and set the pointer upon the capital city of Ptarth.

column2: With a word of farewell he touched the button which controlled the repulsive rays, and as the flier rose lightly into the air, the engine purred in answer to the touch of his finger upon a second button, the propellers whirred as his hand drew back the speed lever, and Carthoris, Prince of Helium, was off into the gorgeous Martian night beneath the hurtling moons and the million stars.
column3: With a word of farewell he touched the button which controlled the repulsive rays, and as the flier rose lightly into the air, the engine purred in answer to the touch of his finger upon a second button, the propellers whirred as his hand drew back the speed lever, and Carthoris, Prince of Helium, was off into the gorgeous Martian night beneath the hurtling moons and the million stars.

column2: Scarce had the flier found its speed ere the man, wrapping his sleeping silks and furs about him, stretched at full length upon the narrow deck to sleep.
column3: Scarce had the flier found its speed ere the man, wrapping his sleeping silks and furs about him, stretched at full length upon the narrow deck to sleep.

column2: But sleep did not come at once at his bidding.
column3: But sleep did not come at once at his bidding.

column2: Instead, his thoughts ran riot in his brain, driving sleep away. He recalled the words of Thuvia of Ptarth, words that had half assured him that she loved him; for when he had asked her if she loved Kulan Tith, she had answered only that she was promised to him.
column3: Instead, his thoughts ran riot in his brain, driving sleep away. He recalled the words of Thuvia of Ptarth, words that had half assured him that she loved him; for when he had asked her if she loved Kulan Tith, she had answered only that she was promised to him.

column2: Now he saw that her reply was open to more than a single construction. It might, of course, mean that she did not love Kulan Tith; and so, by inference, be taken to mean that she loved another.
column3: Now he saw that her reply was open to more than a single construction. It might, of course, mean that she did not love Kulan Tith; and so, by inference, be taken to mean that she loved another.

column2: But what assurance was there that the other was Carthoris of Helium?
column3: But what assurance was there that the other was Carthoris of Helium?

column2: The more he thought upon it the more positive he became that not only was there no assurance in her words that she loved him, but none either in any act of hers.
column3: The more he thought upon it the more positive he became that not only was there no assurance in her words that she loved him, but none either in any act of hers.

column2: No, the fact was, she did not love him.
column3: No, the fact was, she did not love him.

column2: She loved another.
column3: She loved another.

column2: She had not been abducted--she had fled willingly with her lover.
column3: She had not been abducted-she had fled willingly with her lover.

column2: With such pleasant thoughts filling him alternately with despair and rage, Carthoris at last dropped into the sleep of utter mental exhaustion.
column3: With such pleasant thoughts filling him alternately with despair and rage, Carthoris at last dropped into the sleep of utter mental exhaustion.

column2: The breaking of the sudden dawn found him still asleep.
column3: The breaking of the sudden dawn found him still asleep.

column2: His flier was rushing swiftly above a barren, ochre plain--the world-old bottom of a long-dead Martian sea.
column3: His flier was rushing swiftly above a barren, ochre plain-the world old bottom of a long dead Martian sea.

column2: In the distance rose low hills.
column3: In the distance rose low hills.

column2: Toward these the craft was headed. As it approached them, a great promontory might have been seen from its deck, stretching out into what had once been a mighty ocean, and circling back once more to enclose the forgotten harbour of a forgotten city, which still stretched back from its deserted quays, an imposing pile of wondrous architecture of a long-dead past.
column3: Toward these the craft was headed. As it approached them, a great promontory might have been seen from its deck, stretching out into what had once been a mighty ocean, and circling back once more to enclose the forgotten harbour of a forgotten city, which still stretched back from its deserted quays, an imposing pile of wondrous architecture of a long dead past.

column2: The countless dismal windows, vacant and forlorn, stared, sightless, from their marble walls; the whole sad city taking on the semblance of scattered mounds of dead men's sun-bleached skulls--the casements having the appearance of eyeless sockets, the portals, grinning jaws.
column3: The countless dismal windows, vacant and forlorn, stared, sightless, from their marble walls; the whole sad city taking on the semblance of scattered mounds of dead men's sun bleached skulls-the casements having the appearance of eyeless sockets, the portals, grinning jaws.

column2: Closer came the flier, but now its speed was diminishing--yet this was not Ptarth.
column3: Closer came the flier, but now its speed was diminishing-yet this was not Ptarth.

column2: Above the central plaza it stopped, slowly settling Marsward. Within a hundred yards of the ground it came to rest, floating gently in the light air, and at the same instant an alarm sounded at the sleeper's ear.
column3: Above the central plaza it stopped, slowly settling Marsward. Within a hundred yards of the ground it came to rest, floating gently in the light air, and at the same instant an alarm sounded at the sleeper's ear.

column2: Carthoris sprang to his feet.
column3: Carthoris sprang to his feet.

column2: Below him he looked to see the teeming metropolis of Ptarth.
column3: Below him he looked to see the teeming metropolis of Ptarth.

column2: Beside him, already, there should have been an air patrol.
column3: Beside him, already, there should have been an air patrol.

column2: He gazed about in bewildered astonishment.
column3: He gazed about in bewildered astonishment.

column2: There indeed was a great city, but it was not Ptarth.
column3: There indeed was a great city, but it was not Ptarth.

column2: No multitudes surged through its broad avenues.
column3: No multitudes surged through its broad avenues.

column2: No signs of life broke the dead monotony of its deserted roof tops.
column3: No signs of life broke the dead monotony of its deserted roof tops.

column2: No gorgeous silks, no priceless furs lent life and colour to the cold marble and the gleaming ersite.
column3: No gorgeous silks, no priceless furs lent life and colour to the cold marble and the gleaming ersite.

column2: No patrol boat lay ready with its familiar challenge.
column3: No patrol boat lay ready with its familiar challenge.

column2: Silent and empty lay the great city--empty and silent the surrounding air.
column3: Silent and empty lay the great city-empty and silent the surrounding air.

column2: What had happened?
column3: What had happened?

column2: Carthoris examined the dial of his compass.
column3: Carthoris examined the dial of his compass.

column2: The pointer was set upon Ptarth.
column3: The pointer was set upon Ptarth.

column2: Could the creature of his genius have thus betrayed him?
column3: Could the creature of his genius have thus betrayed him?

column2: He would not believe it.
column3: He would not believe it.

column2: Quickly he unlocked the cover, turning it back upon its hinge.
column3: Quickly he unlocked the cover, turning it back upon its hinge.

column2: A single glance showed him the truth, or at least a part of it--the steel projection that communicated the movement of the pointer upon the dial to the heart of the mechanism beneath had been severed.
column3: A single glance showed him the truth, or at least a part of it-the steel projection that communicated the movement of the pointer upon the dial to the heart of the mechanism beneath had been severed.

column2: Who could have done the thing--and why?
column3: Who could have done the thing-and why?

column2: Carthoris could not hazard even a faint guess.
column3: Carthoris could not hazard even a faint guess.

column2: But the thing now was to learn in what portion of the world he was, and then take up his interrupted journey once more.
column3: But the thing now was to learn in what portion of the world he was, and then take up his interrupted journey once more.

column2: If it had been the purpose of some enemy to delay him, he had succeeded well, thought Carthoris, as he unlocked the cover of the second dial the first having shown that its pointer had not been set at all.
column3: If it had been the purpose of some enemy to delay him, he had succeeded well, thought Carthoris, as he unlocked the cover of the second dial the first having shown that its pointer had not been set at all.

column2: Beneath the second dial he found the steel pin severed as in the other, but the controlling mechanism had first been set for a point upon the western hemisphere.
column3: Beneath the second dial he found the steel pin severed as in the other, but the controlling mechanism had first been set for a point upon the western hemisphere.

column2: He had just time to judge his location roughly at some place south-west of Helium, and at a considerable distance from the twin cities, when he was startled by a woman's scream beneath him.
column3: He had just time to judge his location roughly at some place south-west of Helium, and at a considerable distance from the twin cities, when he was startled by a woman's scream beneath him.

column2: Leaning over the side of the flier, he saw what appeared to be a red woman being dragged across the plaza by a huge green warrior--one of those fierce, cruel denizens of the dead sea-bottoms and deserted cities of dying Mars.
column3: Leaning over the side of the flier, he saw what appeared to be a red woman being dragged across the plaza by a huge green warrior-one of those fierce, cruel denizens of the dead sea bottoms and deserted cities of dying Mars.

column2: Carthoris waited to see no more.
column3: Carthoris waited to see no more.

column2: Reaching for the control board, he sent his craft racing plummet-like toward the ground.
column3: Reaching for the control board, he sent his craft racing plummet like toward the ground.

column2: The green man was hurrying his captive toward a huge thoat that browsed upon the ochre vegetation of the once scarlet-gorgeous plaza.
column3: The green man was hurrying his captive toward a huge thoat that browsed upon the ochre vegetation of the once scarlet gorgeous plaza.

column2: At the same instant a dozen red warriors leaped from the entrance of a nearby ersite palace, pursuing the abductor with naked swords and shouts of rageful warning.
column3: At the same instant a dozen red warriors leaped from the entrance of a nearby ersite palace, pursuing the abductor with naked swords and shouts of rageful warning.

column2: Once the woman turned her face upward toward the falling flier, and in the single swift glance Carthoris saw that it was Thuvia of Ptarth!
column3: Once the woman turned her face upward toward the falling flier, and in the single swift glance Carthoris saw that it was Thuvia of Ptarth!
